slide.title: FPM
slide.blurb: FPM (FastCGI Process Manager) is now part of PHP!
Support for .htaccess style INI controls for CGI/ FastCGI

list.bullet: Per-directory INI settings inside php.ini via [PATH=/var/www/domain.com] not modifiable by the user.
Allow use of INI variables and constants from virtually everywhere in the INI files

slide.example:
<?php [PATH=/var/www/domain.com] variables_order = GPC safe_mode = 1
[my variables] somevar = “1234” anothervar = ${somevar} ;
[ini arrays] foo[bar] = 1 foo[123] = 2 foo[] = 3 ?>
slide.blurb: Name for user-defined php.ini (.htaccess) files. Default is ".user.ini"
slide.example:
<?php user_ini.filename = ".user.ini"
To disable this feature set this option to empty value user_ini.filename = ?>
slide.blurb: TTL for user-defined php.ini files (time-to-live) in seconds. Default is 300 seconds (5 minutes)
